channel.title: Error connecting to server
channel.description: When I give my friends my client to play, it loads for them and downloads the cache. When they try to log in, it just says error connecting to server. I have done everything correct that I know of, I replaced the ip's in server.java, gui.java and client.java. My port is open. I can log in just fine. No errors appear, it just doesn't allow them to log on. I am using InsidiaX as my base. Does anybody know what I have done wrong?

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @chalkyracedude chalkyracedude
item.description:
@chalkyracedude wrote:

I think all the ips are changed. I compliled.

it’s a static ip. InsidiaX. I’ll try changing the server file back to localhost.

EDIT: Looks like I did it right, I just can’t connect to my own server >_<

EDITEDIT: Looks like I was being an idiot, all fixed. Thanks for the help guys

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Illadelph:

did you portforward everything correctly? Re-check your static ip to make sure it hasnt changed.

If it has any chance of changing, it’s not a static IP.

Static - Stays the same.
Dynamic - Can change periodically.

On Topic: What source do you have? I know in some sources, you’re not supposed to change the 127.0.0.1, do keep in mind you shouldn’t be changing server files, just the client ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Once again, did you make sure all ip’s are changed, because if you can connect and they can’t, then there’s one of these problems.

  1. You did not compile the client after all changes were made then released it to them.
  2. You did not change ALL the ip’s in the client because in most situations there are more.

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server

item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

did you portforward everything correctly? Re-check your static ip to make sure it hasnt changed.
